rev.diff:
Line 254: Line 254:
On April 27, 2011, Obama provided the 'long form' birth certificate to the press. An image of the birth certificate, which confirmed details that were provided in 2008 on the short-form certification, was posted on the whitehouse.gov website.<ref>[http://www.whitehouse.gov/sites/default/files/rss_viewer/birth-certificate-long-form.pdf Whitehouse.gov]</ref> At a press conference held shortly after the release, Trump credited the release to his efforts.
On April 27, 2011, Obama provided the 'long form' birth certificate to the press. An image of the birth certificate, which confirmed details that were provided in 2008 on the short-form certification, was posted on the whitehouse.gov website.<ref>[http://www.whitehouse.gov/sites/default/files/rss_viewer/birth-certificate-long-form.pdf Whitehouse.gov]</ref> At a press conference held shortly after the release, Trump credited the release to his efforts.
â
In the April 27 press conference, Trump also voiced questions about whether Obama's college grades were sufficient for Harvard admission and called for the release of Obama's transcripts from Occidental College.<ref>[http://nation.foxnews.com/donald-trump/2011/04/08/msnbc-host-wants-parent-company-fire-trump MSNBC Host Wants Parent Company to Fire Trump] [http://washingtonscene.thehill.com/in-the-know/36-news/9131-weiner-nbc-should-tell-trump-youre-fired Weiner: NBC Should Tell Trump "You're Fired"]</ref> Trump's comments at the April 27th conference unleashed a new wave of criticism against Trump, as many interpreted his remarks as implied racism.<ref>there are lots of source for this-- add one.</ref> Trump's statments about Obama was the focus of numerous jokes during the 2011 White House Correspondents Dinner.
+
In the April 27 press conference, Trump also voiced questions about whether Obama's college grades were sufficient for Harvard admission and called for the release of Obama's transcripts from Occidental College.<ref>[http://nation.foxnews.com/donald-trump/2011/04/08/msnbc-host-wants-parent-company-fire-trump MSNBC Host Wants Parent Company to Fire Trump] [http://washingtonscene.thehill.com/in-the-know/36-news/9131-weiner-nbc-should-tell-trump-youre-fired Weiner: NBC Should Tell Trump "You're Fired"]</ref> Trump's comments at the April 27th conference unleashed a new wave of criticism against Trump, as many interpreted his remarks as implied racism.<ref>there are lots of source for this-- add one.</ref> Trump's statements about Obama were a focus of numerous jokes during the 2011 White House Correspondents Dinner.
